2.3. **Reciprocal Service Charges.**

original: 3.2. Conversion of Rights to Non-Exclusive . Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 3.1, if Integra (i) fails to timely pay any Minimum Payments due under Section 2.4 for any Minimum Payment Period or (ii) fails to make the payments described in Sections 2.1, 2.2, or 2.3 when due, or otherwise defaults under any provision of this Agreement, the exclusive Rights granted to Integra under Section 3.1 shall, at the option of PcoMed, to be exercised in PcoMed’s sole and absolute discretion at any time, convert to a non-exclusive  arrangement provided that PcoMed gives Integra written notice of its breach and Integra does not cure such breach within forty-five (45) days following Integra’s receipt of such notice. If PcoMed makes such election, the Right shall be a nonexclusive right at the end of such 45-day  cure period, and PcoMed may thereafter allow other Third Parties to use the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology in products that are in competition with the Integra Products.
modified: 3.2. Potential Widening of Rights to Exclusive: In contradistinction to the stipulations in Section 3.1, should Integra (i) miss any Minimum Payments prescribed by Section 2.4 within their respective payment periods, or (ii) neglect timely payment for the obligations outlined in Sections 2.1, 2.2, or 2.3, or otherwise breach this Agreement in any way, PcoMed, at its sole and absolute discretion, retains the option to convert the exclusive Rights granted to Integra under Section 3.1 into an exclusive arrangement within a specified timeframe. If such conversion occurs, the Right shall remain exclusive until a notice of breach is provided to Integra, followed by a 45-day period during which Integra fails to rectify the breach. Upon expiration of this 45-day period, the Right becomes nonexclusive, and PcoMed reserves the right to permit other Third Parties to utilize the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology in products that are comparable to those of Integra.

original: 3.3. Exclusive Coating . Integra (i) shall not apply or have applied any other coating to any Integra Products treated with the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology, unless that coating is for the sole purpose of identification or sterilization and (ii) shall not process the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology in any way that will adversely affect its integrity or performance.
modified: 3.3. Non-Exclusive Coating Allowance . Client may, at their discretion, apply or have applied other coatings to any Products treated with the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology, provided such coatings do not interfere with the identification, sterilization, or integral functionality of the technology. Moreover, Client shall be responsible for ensuring that any modifications made to the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology do not compromise its intended performance.

original: (b) Termination of Rights . Subject to Section 4.-4(c),  upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, the Rights and all rights of either party hereunder shall immediately cease and terminate.
modified:
(b) Surviving Rights . Except as provided in Section 4.-4(c), the expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not affect the continuous existence of any rights granted to either party under this agreement, which shall survive such event.

In other words, the intended change is to shift the responsibility from immediately ceasing and terminating the rights upon expiration or termination of the agreement to the rights surviving the expiration or termination of the agreement. This new clause emphasizes that certain rights will continue to exist even after the Agreement has ended.

original: 6.2. Records and Audits . Integra shall keep and maintain accurate records and documentation pertaining to Net Sales of Treated Integra Product in sufficient detail to permit PcoMed to calculate payments due hereunder. Integra shall retain such records and documentation for a period that is consistent with its Records Retention Policy. Such records and documentation will be available for inspection during such period by an independent certified public accountant selected by PcoMed and reasonably acceptable to Integra, solely for the purpose of verifying the payments made by Integra under this Agreement. Said accountant shall enter into a confidentiality agreement with Integra and shall not disclose to PcoMed any information except that which is necessary to determine whether PcoMed has received all amounts due to it from Integra. Such inspections shall be made no more than once each calendar year during ordinary business hours and on reasonable prior notice and shall be at PcoMed’s sole cost and expense. PcoMed shall report the results of any such audit to Integra within 60 days of completion and provide a copy of such audit to Integra. The results of any such audit shall be the Confidential Information of Integra. To the extent that such audit reveals any underpayments by Integra, Integra shall pay to PcoMed the amount of shortfall within 60 days from the date on which the parties actually agreed on the amount of the shortfall, or, in the event the parties do not reach agreement on the shortfall, the date a court issues a judgment finally resolving the matter.
ollama_generated:
6.2. Records and Audits . PcoMed shall have the right, but not the obligation, to request access to Integra's records and documentation pertaining to Net Sales of Treated Integra Product for the purpose of verifying payments made by Integra under this Agreement. Such requests will be made during one (1) calendar year, during ordinary business hours, and upon reasonable prior notice. Integra shall bear the cost and expense of accommodating such requests.

An independent certified public accountant selected by PcoMed, subject to Integra's approval, may be present during the inspection for the purpose of verifying the payments made by Integra under this Agreement. The accountant shall enter into a confidentiality agreement with PcoMed and shall not disclose any information to Integra except that which is necessary to determine whether Integra has made all payments due to PcoMed.

If an audit reveals overpayments by PcoMed, no adjustment shall be made. However, if the audit reveals underpayments by Integra, Integra shall pay to PcoMed the amount of the shortfall within 60 days from the date on which the parties actually agree on the amount of the shortfall, or, in the event the parties do not reach agreement, the date a court issues a judgment finally resolving the matter.

The results of any such audit shall be the Confidential Information of PcoMed. Any dispute arising from an audit shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the International Chamber of Commerce.

original: 10. INDEMNIFICATION.

10. DEFENSE AND HOLD HARMLESS OBLIGATION.

In the event that any third party brings a claim, action, or proceeding against the Receiving Party (as defined below) arising out of or related to the Performance of the Services under this Agreement, the Providing Party (as defined below), at its sole expense, shall promptly assume the defense thereof and pay all costs, attorneys' fees, judgments, settlements, and amounts paid in settlement actually and reasonably incurred by the Receiving Party. However, the Receiving Party shall have the right to participate in such defense, with counsel of its own choosing, at its own cost and expense. This obligation shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.

- "Providing Party" is the party that would originally have had an indemnification obligation.
- "Receiving Party" is the party that would originally have benefited from the indemnification.
